# Completely Randomized Design (CRD)

A **Completely Randomized Design (CRD)** is the simplest type of experimental design.  
In a CRD, all experimental units are assigned to treatments completely at random, so every unit has an equal chance of receiving any treatment.

---

### When to Use a CRD

- Itâ€™s used when experimental units are **homogeneous** (similar in all relevant aspects).  
- The model assumes that observed differences between treatment means are due to **treatment effects and random error**.  
- Analysis is typically done using a **one-way ANOVA**, where total variability is partitioned into *between treatments* and *within treatments (error)*.
